p: Mice vaccinated with ChAdOx1-based vaccines were challenged using two different lineages. Wild-type mice ( Figure 4) were challenged with an intravenous injection of 10 5 vp (equivalent to 10 2 PFU) of ZIKV AS, consisting of the ZKV2015 (ZIKV BR), as described earlier [ 36, 37]. To extend our observations, the experiment depicted in Figure 5 used A129 mice undergoing a heterologous challenge with a ZIKV AF strain, made with 100 PFU ZIKV AF (MP1751) via the subcutaneous (s.c.) route, to mimic mosquito bite [ 35]; 40 μL into the right leg and 40 μL into left leg toward the ankle. Mice of the protein vaccine experiment were challenged with 10 4 PFU Puerto Rican strain ZIKV (PRVABC59) always by the s.c. route, which was performed at a different lab from the ChAdOx1 vaccines.
